item.title: Manage environment variables with powershell
item.description: List environment variables Get-ChildItem -Path Env:\ Also, using .net from powershell, and specifying system-level variables, by specifying machine as second argument. This argument could also be user [System.Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable('PATH','machine') For some reason, the previous doesn’t work for COMPUTERNAME. To get computer name: $env:computername Set environment variable Run powershell as Admin. new variable [System.Environment]::SetEnvironmentVariable('FOO', 'bar',[System.EnvironmentVariableTarget]::Machine) add to an existing variable (typically to PATH) $current=[System.Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable('FOO','machine');$newpath="$current;new/stuff in the/path";[System.Environment]::SetEnvironmentVariable('FOO', $newpath,[System.EnvironmentVariableTarget]::Machine) Enable windows feature (ServerManager) First, run Powershell as admin, instal RSAT (includes ServerManager Module).
